definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: He still is a remarkable rehearsal and director.
sentences.chinese: 他还是一位杰出的排练者与指挥者。

sentences.english: The demander instructed soldiers to wait until further information.
sentences.chinese: 指挥者命令士兵等下去，直到进一步通知。

sentences.english: He was also the actual commander in the two Chen-suppressed battles.
sentences.chinese: 还成为两次平陈战争的实际指挥者。

sentences.english: You are your brain, no more and no less.
sentences.chinese: 你只是你大脑的指挥者。

definition: to conduct/to command/to direct/conductor (of an orchestra)/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
to go to war/to engage in war
SS or Schutzstaffel, paramilitary organization in Nazi Germany
